Description: Green glazed steatite scarab, elytra marked and humeral callosities present, pierced both longitudinally and transversely, base finely carved with figure of horse walking to right, and inscribed with two cartouches at sides, containing prenomen.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1913 / Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, etc. in the British Museum (1032)
Acquisition notes: Lot 66 in auction, Sotheby's, London, 5 March 1836 (purchased via Cureton).
